scenarioDescription:
The K2-261 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-261 is a star with 1.1 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.65 times its radius. It is located 695.64 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-261 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-261 system


K2-261 b

K2-261 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-261 b is 70.914 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-261 b is 9.528 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-261 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-261, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-261 - System With 1 Exoplanet
